key.name: homepage-url
key.description: Address of the user’s home page.

key.name: default-search-engine
key.description: Name of the search engine selected by default.

key.name: search-engines
key.description: List of the default search engines. It is an array in which each search engine is described by a name, an address, and a bang (shortcut).

key.name: new-windows-in-tabs
key.summary: Force new windows to be opened in tabs
key.description: Force new window requests to be opened in tabs instead of using a new window.

key.name: internal-view-source
key.summary: Don’t use an external application to view page source.

key.name: restore-session-policy
key.summary: Whether to automatically restore the last session
key.description: Defines how the session will be restored during startup. Allowed values are “always” (the previous state of the application is always restored), “crashed” (the session is only restored if the application crashes) and “never” (the homepage is always shown).

key.name: restore-session-delaying-loads
key.summary: Whether to delay loading of tabs that are not immediately visible on session restore
key.description: When this option is set to true, tabs will not start loading until the user switches to them, upon session restore.

key.name: adblock-filters
key.description: List of URLs with filter rules to be used by the adblock.

key.name: expand-tabs-bar
key.summary: Expand tabs size to fill the available space on the tabs bar.
key.description: If enabled the tabs will expand to use the entire available space in the tabs bar.

key.name: tabs-bar-position
key.summary: The position of the tabs bar.
key.description: Controls where the tabs bar is shown. Possible values are “top” (the default), “bottom”, “left” (vertical tabs with bar on the left) and “right” (vertical tabs with bar on the right).

key.name: tabs-bar-visibility-policy
key.summary: The visibility policy for the tabs bar.
key.description: Controls when the tabs bar is shown. Possible values are “always” (the tabs bar is always shown), “more-than-one” (the tabs bar is only shown if there’s two or more tabs) and “never” (the tabs bar is never shown).

key.name: keep-window-open
key.summary: Keep window open when closing last tab
key.description: If enabled application window is kept open when closing the last tab.

key.name: font-style
key.description: Chooses the style of the main body text for articles in reader mode. Possible values are “sans” and “serif”.

key.name: color-scheme
key.description: Selects the style of colors for articles displayed in reader mode. Possible values are “light” (dark text on light background) and “dark” (light text on dark background).

key.name: use-gnome-fonts
key.description: Use GNOME font settings.

key.name: sans-serif-font
key.description: A value to be used to override sans-serif desktop font when use-gnome-fonts is set.

key.name: serif-font
key.description: A value to be used to override serif desktop font when use-gnome-fonts is set.

key.name: monospace-font
key.description: A value to be used to override monospace desktop font when use-gnome-fonts is set.

key.name: enable-user-css
key.description: Use a custom CSS file to modify websites own CSS.

key.name: enable-spell-checking
key.description: Spell check any text typed in editable areas.

key.name: default-encoding
key.description: Default encoding. Accepted values are the ones WebKitGTK can understand.

key.name: language
key.description: Preferred languages. Array of locale codes or “system” to use current locale.

key.name: cookies-policy
key.description: Where to accept cookies from. Possible values are “always”, “no-third-party” and “never”.

key.name: enable-popups
key.description: Allow sites to open new windows using JavaScript (if JavaScript is enabled).

key.name: enable-webgl
key.description: Whether to enable support for WebGL contexts.

key.name: enable-webaudio
key.description: Whether to enable support for WebAudio.

key.name: enable-smooth-scrolling
key.description: Whether to enable smooth scrolling.

key.name: user-agent
key.description: String that will be used as user agent, to identify the browser to the web servers.

key.name: do-not-track
key.description: Enables tracking query parameter removal. Note that when changing this setting from the preferences dialog, the adblock-filters setting will additionally be updated to add/remove EasyPrivacy filters.

key.name: enable-adblock
key.description: Whether to block the embedded advertisements that web pages might want to show.

key.name: remember-passwords
key.description: Whether to store and prefill passwords in websites.

key.name: enable-site-specific-quirks
key.description: Enable quirks to make specific websites work better. You might want to disable this setting if debugging a specific issue.

key.name: enable-safe-browsing
key.description: Whether to enable safe browsing. Safe browsing operates via Google Safe Browsing API v4.

key.name: gsb-api-key
key.description: The API key used to access the Google Safe Browsing API v4.

key.name: default-zoom-level
key.summary: Default zoom level for new pages

key.name: enable-autosearch
key.description: Whether to automatically search the web when something that does not look like a URL is entered in the address bar. If this setting is disabled, everything will be loaded as a URL unless a search engine is explicitly selected from the dropdown menu.

key.name: enable-mouse-gestures
key.description: Whether to enable mouse gestures. Mouse gestures are based on Opera’s behaviour and are activated using the middle mouse button + gesture.

key.name: last-upload-directory
key.description: Keep track of last upload directory

key.name: last-download-directory
key.description: Keep track of last download directory

key.name: hardware-acceleration-policy
key.description: Whether to enable hardware acceleration. Possible values are “on-demand”, “always”, and “never”. Hardware acceleration may be required to achieve acceptable performance on embedded devices, but increases memory usage requirements and could expose severe hardware-specific graphics driver bugs. When the policy is “on-demand”, hardware acceleration will be used only when required to display 3D transforms.

key.name: additional-urls
key.description: The list of URLs that should be opened by the web application

key.name: download-dir
key.description: The path of the folder where to download files to; or “Downloads” to use the default downloads folder, or “Desktop” to use the desktop folder.

key.name: window-position
key.description: The position to use for a new window that is not restored from a previous session.

key.name: window-size
key.description: The size to use for a new window that is not restored from a previous session.

key.name: is-maximized
key.description: Whether a new window that is not restored from a previous session should be initially maximized.

key.name: disable-history
key.description: If set to “true”, forward and back buttons are disabled, preventing users from accessing immediate browser history

key.name: sync-user
key.description: The email linked to the Firefox Account used to sync data with Mozilla’s servers.

key.name: sync-time
key.description: The UNIX time at which last sync was made in seconds.

key.name: sync-device-id
key.description: The sync device ID of the current device.

key.name: sync-device-name
key.description: The sync device name of the current device.

key.name: sync-frequency
key.description: The number of minutes between two consecutive syncs.

key.name: sync-with-firefox
key.description: TRUE if Ephy collections should be synced with Firefox collections, FALSE otherwise.

key.name: sync-bookmarks-enabled
key.description: TRUE if bookmarks collection should be synced, FALSE otherwise.

key.name: sync-bookmarks-time
key.description: The timestamp at which last bookmarks sync was made.

key.name: sync-bookmarks-initial
key.description: TRUE if bookmarks collection needs to be synced for the first time, FALSE otherwise.

key.name: sync-passwords-enabled
key.description: TRUE if passwords collection should be synced, FALSE otherwise.

key.name: sync-passwords-time
key.description: The timestamp at which last passwords sync was made.

key.name: sync-passwords-initial
key.description: TRUE if passwords collection needs to be synced for the first time, FALSE otherwise.

key.name: sync-history-enabled
key.description: TRUE if history collection should be synced, FALSE otherwise.

key.name: sync-history-time
key.description: The timestamp at which last history sync was made.

key.name: sync-history-initial
key.description: TRUE if history collection needs to be synced for the first time, FALSE otherwise.

key.name: sync-open-tabs-enabled
key.description: TRUE if open tabs collection should be synced, FALSE otherwise.

key.name: sync-open-tabs-time
key.description: The timestamp at which last open tabs sync was made.

key.name: audio-device-permission
key.summary: Decision to apply when microphone permission is requested for this host
key.description: This option is used to save whether a given host has been given permission to access the user’s microphone. The “undecided” default means the browser needs to ask the user for permission, while “allow” and “deny” tell it to automatically make the decision upon request.

key.name: geolocation-permission
key.summary: Decision to apply when geolocation permission is requested for this host
key.description: This option is used to save whether a given host has been given permission to access the user’s location. The “undecided” default means the browser needs to ask the user for permission, while “allow” and “deny” tell it to automatically make the decision upon request.

key.name: notifications-permission
key.summary: Decision to apply when notification permission is requested for this host
key.description: This option is used to save whether a given host has been given permission to show notifications. The “undecided” default means the browser needs to ask the user for permission, while “allow” and “deny” tell it to automatically make the decision upon request.

key.name: save-password-permission
key.summary: Decision to apply when save password permission is requested for this host
key.description: This option is used to save whether a given host has been given permission to save passwords. The “undecided” default means the browser needs to ask the user for permission, while “allow” and “deny” tell it to automatically make the decision upon request.

key.name: video-device-permission
key.summary: Decision to apply when webcam permission is requested for this host
key.description: This option is used to save whether a given host has been given permission to access the user’s webcam. The “undecided” default means the browser needs to ask the user for permission, while “allow” and “deny” tell it to automatically make the decision upon request.

key.name: advertisement-permission
key.summary: Decision to apply when advertisement permission is requested for this host
key.description: This option is used to save whether a given host has been given permission to allow advertisements. The “undecided” default means the browser global setting is used, while “allow” and “deny” tell it to automatically make the decision upon request.
